description: During my time at Vocational High School (Sekolah Menengah Kejuruan or SMK), I studied HTML for creating web page structures, CSS for layout and visual styling, and PHP as a server-side programming language for dynamic web applications. Java was taught as a general-purpose programming language, possibly for developing Java-based applications. NetBeans, an integrated development environment (IDE), was used to support languages like Java and PHP. MySQL was taught as a relational database management system for storing and managing data in web applications. All of these elements provided a solid foundation in web development and programming during my studies at SMK.

During college, the curriculum covered CodeIgniter, a PHP framework for web development, and Laragon, an efficient local development environment. Git, as a version control system, was emphasized for team collaboration and code management. Time management was highlighted to enhance productivity. Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD) was studied as a tool for designing a database, visualizing relationships between entities. All these concepts formed a strong foundation in software development and information technology, providing a profound understanding of framework usage, local servers, team collaboration, time management, and database design throughout the university studies.
